title: 3 headless bodies found in Ondo river
text:
There was panic in Odigbo local government area of Ondo state following the shocking discovery of three headless bodies floating in a river along the Odigbo-Ore old Road.
The discovery was made Sunday when locals stumbled upon the decomposing bodies floating in the river, with some bodies logged at the riverbanks.
Eyewitness accounts stated that the victims were brutally murdered and dumped in the river by suspected kidnappers.
One man identified simply as Shileola, an immediate past youth leader of the community, expressed shock over the incident.
He said: “I was shocked when I first heard about it over the phone. I rushed to the scene, hoping to identify the victims through their clothing or any other means, but all efforts proved abortive.”
He speculated that the victims might have been killed elsewhere and their bodies dumped in the river, as no reports of missing persons have been recorded in the area so far.
The youth leader however, urged residents to remain vigilant and security-conscious in the wake of the incident.
While as of the time of filing this report, the exact cause and those behind the gruesome death remains unknown in the community.
In his reaction, the state Police Public Relations Officer, Ayanlade Olayinka, confirmed that some three bodies were recovered at a river in Odigbo.
He said immediately it was reported at the Ore Division, the DPO of that division moved a detective to the scene where the three bodies were recovered.
